event: Early Maya villages established; development of agriculture and pottery.
Start of the Classic Maya period; major cities like Tikal, El Mirador, and Uaxactun flourish.
Decline of Classic Maya civilization; many cities abandoned.
Spanish conquest of Guatemala begins under Pedro de Alvarado.
Guatemala becomes part of the Spanish Captaincy General of Guatemala.
Guatemala declares independence from Spain.
Joins the United Provinces of Central America.
Becomes fully independent after the dissolution of the Central American Federation.
Liberal Reform begins, promoting modernization and coffee exports.
Revolution ousts dictator Jorge Ubico; beginning of democratic reforms.
CIA-backed coup overthrows President Jacobo Árbenz, ending reforms.
Start of Guatemalan Civil War between military governments and leftist guerrillas.
Massive earthquake kills over 23,000 people and devastates infrastructure.
Efraín Ríos Montt seizes power in military coup; brutal counterinsurgency campaign begins.
Peace accords signed, ending 36-year civil war.
Truth Commission reveals over 200,000 people killed or disappeared during civil war.
Former dictator Ríos Montt convicted of genocide, later overturned.
President Otto Pérez Molina resigns amid corruption scandal; mass protests ensue.
Fuego volcano erupts, killing hundreds.
COVID-19 pandemic hits Guatemala's economy and healthcare system.
